message_1:
Given the following data sets for the hours of study and the corresponding grades obtained by a group of 10 students in mathematics:

Hours of study: 3 4 6 7 8 10 11 12 14 15
Grades obtained: 45 55 60 65 70 75 80 85 90 95

Calculate the correlation coefficient between the hours of study and the grades obtained by the students.
message_2:
To calculate the correlation coefficient (r) between the hours of study and the grades obtained by the students, we will use the following formula:

r = Σ[(xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ)] / √[Σ(xi - x̄)² * Σ(yi - ȳ)²]

where xi and yi are individual data points, x̄ is the mean of the x values (hours of study), and ȳ is the mean of the y values (grades obtained).

First, let's find the mean of the hours of study (x̄) and the mean of the grades obtained (ȳ):

x̄ = (3 + 4 + 6 + 7 + 8 + 10 + 11 + 12 + 14 + 15) / 10 = 90 / 10 = 9
ȳ = (45 + 55 + 60 + 65 + 70 + 75 + 80 + 85 + 90 + 95) / 10 = 720 / 10 = 72

Next, we will calculate the numerator and denominator of the formula:

Numerator: Σ[(xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ)]
Denominator: √[Σ(xi - x̄)² * Σ(yi - ȳ)²]

For each data point, we will calculate (xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ), (xi - x̄)², and (yi - ȳ)²:

(3-9)(45-72) = -6 * -27 = 162
(4-9)(55-72) = -5 * -17 = 85
(6-9)(60-72) = -3 * -12 = 36
(7-9)(65-72) = -2 * -7 = 14
(8-9)(70-72) = -1 * -2 = 2
(10-9)(75-72) = 1 * 3 = 3
(11-9)(80-72) = 2 * 8 = 16
(12-9)(85-72) = 3 * 13 = 39
(14-9)(90-72) = 5 * 18 = 90
(15-9)(95-72) = 6 * 23 = 138

Sum of (xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ): 162 + 85 + 36 + 14 + 2 + 3 + 16 + 39 + 90 + 138 = 585

(3-9)² = 36
(4-9)² = 25
(6-9)² = 9
(7-9)² = 4
(8-9)² = 1
(10-9)² = 1
(11-9)² = 4
(12-9)² = 9
(14-9)² = 25
(15-9)² = 36

Sum of (xi - x̄)²: 36 + 25 + 9 + 4 + 1 + 1 + 4 + 9 + 25 + 36 = 150

(45-72)² = 729
(55-72)² = 289
(60-72)² = 144
(65-72)² = 49
(70-72)² = 4
(75-72)² = 9
(80-72)² = 64
(85-72)² = 169
(90-72)² = 324
(95-72)² = 529

Sum of (yi - ȳ)²: 729 + 289 + 144 + 49 + 4 + 9 + 64 + 169 + 324 + 529 = 2310

Now we can calculate the correlation coefficient (r):

r = 585 / √(150 * 2310) = 585 / √346500 ≈ 0.976

The correlation coefficient between the hours of study and the grades obtained by the students is approximately 0.976, which indicates a strong positive correlation between the two variables.
